translation: On the fourth of the current month, I marched from this camp with 80 cavalrymen and the 3rd Battalion, as I informed Your Excellency Frutuoso, where the commander was killed, who was the so-called Commander Juca Jacinto, the great murderer Pacheco, and 5 prisoners, among them a Lieutenant Bento, very murderous. Lieutenant Colonel Melo stayed at Pavão with the Battalion, and at dawn the enemy was discovered at a distance of half a league; I pursued them for over a league and a half under heavy fire, and due to tiring almost all the horses, the last rebel was not captured; more than 10 saddled horses and four prisoners were left, and one seriously wounded, I believe he will not escape, which is why I left him recovering in a house.
